featuredServices.text: LAA closure devices, PFO occluders, and septal defect devices face unique challenges that standard cardiac testing can't address. featuredServices.heading: Coronary Stent Testing

Whether you're working with established DES platforms or newer bioresorbable scaffolds, our protocols are designed to support both 510(k) and PMA pathways.

featuredServices.heading: Thrombectomy Testing
featuredServices.text: Mechanical thrombectomy devices need to prove they can engage clots effectively, achieve first-pass recanalization, and preserve vessel integrity during emergency stroke procedures. We test device performance using advanced clot simulation systems that replicate diverse thrombus compositions, validating retrieval mechanics and TICI scoring across stent retrievers and combination devices. Our catheterization laboratories provide angiographic documentation of recanalization success while anatomically accurate cerebral vessel models enable realistic performance assessment throughout the entire study.

featuredServices.heading: Direct Aspiration Thrombectomy Testing
featuredServices.text: Aspiration catheters require validation of vacuum force generation, clot extraction efficiency, and complete vessel recanalization across neurovascular, coronary, and peripheral applications. We evaluate aspiration performance using standardized clot compositions—from fresh platelet-rich thrombi to organized fibrin material—ensuring devices handle the full spectrum of clinical scenarios. Our testing protocols assess catheter trackability through tortuous cerebral anatomy, aspiration force consistency during extended procedures, and biocompatibility requirements for blood-contacting devices.

featuredServices.heading: Liquid Embolic Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Liquid embolic agents face unique challenges that standard biocompatibility testing can't address. We validate polymer viscosity, radiopacity, and polymerization kinetics using specialized protocols for DMSO compatibility, tantalum suspension stability, and controlled precipitation behavior. Our catheterization laboratories feature imaging systems configured specifically for liquid embolic visualization, while ISO 10993-compliant testing addresses material characterization and delivery performance across aneurysm, AVM, and peripheral embolization applications.

peripheral-vascular-testing.whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony Labs for Peripheral Vascular Testing
peripheral-vascular-testing.whyChooseDescription: Our peripheral vascular testing expertise combines 40+ years of cardiovascular device validation experience with specialized infrastructure addressing the unique requirements of carotid, aortic, venous, and embolic protection technologies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Territory-Specific Expertise
whyChooseCards.text: Our team recognizes that carotid stents, AAA devices, IVC filters, and embolic protection systems each require distinct testing approaches. Our protocols address territory-specific biomechanical challenges, regulatory expectations, and clinical performance requirements rather than applying generic vascular device assessment methodologies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Specialized Testing Infrastructure
whyChooseCards.text: Purpose-built testing systems address peripheral vascular requirements including high-pressure aortic simulation, cerebrovascular flow modeling, venous circulation replication, and embolic challenge systems. This specialized infrastructure enables comprehensive device validation that generic cardiovascular facilities cannot provide.

whyChooseCards.heading: Multi-Disciplinary Team
whyChooseCards.text: Our personnel include interventional specialists with expertise across cerebrovascular, aortic, and venous territories, biomedical engineers specializing in vascular device mechanics, and regulatory experts with successful peripheral device submission experience. This combination ensures comprehensive evaluation addressing both technical performance and regulatory acceptance.

featuredServices.heading: Carotid Stent Testing
featuredServices.text: Carotid stent development requires specialized cerebrovascular testing that addresses embolic risk, plaque stabilization, and vessel scaffolding in the critical carotid circulation. We evaluate embolic generation, plaque compression, and patency maintenance using anatomically accurate carotid bifurcation models that replicate the unique hemodynamics of cerebral circulation. Our testing protocols span self-expanding nitinol systems, balloon-expandable designs, and drug-eluting platforms, with advanced embolic monitoring systems evaluating particle generation during deployment across various plaque types. Specialized protocols assess plaque stabilization effectiveness, deployment precision through tortuous anatomy, and chronic thrombogenicity in the cerebrovascular environment.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About Carotid Stent Testing

featuredServices.heading: AAA Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Abdominal aortic aneurysm repair systems need to prove they can withstand systolic pressure cycles while providing complete aneurysm exclusion and maintaining critical branch vessel perfusion. We evaluate pressure containment, endoleak prevention, and structural integrity using high-pressure flow circuits and anatomically accurate aneurysm models that accommodate modular stent grafts, unibody designs, and fenestrated devices with branch vessel preservation. Advanced pressure monitoring provides real-time seal integrity assessment while leak detection systems identify potential endoleak pathways. Accelerated fatigue testing simulates decades of cardiac pressure cycles, characterizing material durability and component interface integrity throughout intended device life.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About AAA Device Testing

featuredServices.heading: IVC Filter Testing
featuredServices.text: Inferior vena cava filter development requires specialized venous testing that addresses clot capture efficiency, flow preservation, and retrieval mechanics in the low-pressure, large-diameter venous environment. We evaluate embolic challenge response, anchoring stability, and biocompatibility using high-volume venous flow circuits that replicate physiological IVC hemodynamics. Our testing addresses both permanent filter designs requiring long-term biocompatibility validation and retrievable systems demanding comprehensive retrieval mechanics assessment. Advanced embolic simulation systems deliver calibrated thrombus analogs across clinically relevant size ranges while specialized protocols characterize retrieval force requirements and safe recovery timelines.
featuredServices.ctaText: Learn More About IVC Filter Testing

whyChooseCards.text: Dedicated surgical suite accommodates full robotic systems with patient cart positioning, vision cart integration, and surgeon console setup matching clinical configurations. Environmental controls maintain sterile conditions and consistent testing parameters throughout validation studies.

whyChooseCards.heading: Minimally Invasive Expertise
whyChooseCards.text: Our founding heritage established by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered current minimally invasive techniques provides deep understanding of precision surgical requirements. whyChooseCards.text: AAALAC accreditation ensures highest standards for surgical research protocols while GLP compliance under 21 CFR Part 58 provides regulatory documentation required for FDA submissions. Our quality management system delivers complete traceability and comprehensive documentation supporting successful regulatory pathways for complex electromechanical systems.

featuredServices.heading: Endoscopic Device Testing
featuredServices.text: Flexible endoscopic systems for robotic surgery require validation of mechanical articulation, visualization performance, and working channel functionality. We test articulation range across multiple degrees of freedom, tip deflection precision under varying loads, and camera resolution for diagnostic imaging. Our protocols evaluate illumination stability, image transmission quality, and working channel patency throughout articulation cycles. Our optical testing equipment and mechanical fatigue systems track performance metrics throughout thousands of articulation cycles to ensure devices meet ISO 8600 standards.

featuredServices.heading: Laparoscopic Testing
featuredServices.text: Minimally invasive surgical instruments for robotic platforms require precise characterization of grasping forces, articulation accuracy, and tissue manipulation capabilities. We evaluate instrument jaw closure forces, articulation precision through multi-degree motion, and durability under repeated actuations exceeding 10,000 cycles per procedure. Our testing protocols assess trocar seal integrity, instrument clearance through access ports, and mechanical stability during tissue manipulation. Our surgical suites feature complete laparoscopic towers and insufflation systems that replicate operating room conditions throughout validation studies.

featuredServices.heading: Robotic System Integration Testing
featuredServices.text: Complete robotic surgical systems require validation of teleoperation accuracy, force feedback calibration, and tremor filtration effectiveness. We test motion scaling verification, emergency stop response times, and software integration between console and patient cart. Our protocols evaluate haptic feedback latency, collision detection systems, and master console ergonomics during extended procedures. Our facility accommodates full robotic systems including patient carts, vision systems, and surgeon consoles configured to match clinical setups.

dcb-testing.heroDescription: Comprehensive combination product testing for drug-coated balloons across coating characterization, drug elution profiling, and vascular tissue uptake validation.
dcb-testing.whyChooseSectionTitle: Why Choose Synchrony for Drug-Coated Balloon Testing
dcb-testing.whyChooseDescription: Our DCB testing capabilities stem from decades of balloon catheter specialization combined with deep understanding of combination product regulatory requirements.

whyChooseCards.heading: Dual Catheterization Laboratories
whyChooseCards.text: Two fully-equipped cath labs with high-resolution fluoroscopy, digital subtraction angiography, IVUS integration, and hemodynamic monitoring systems enable parallel testing programs and complex procedural simulations that replicate clinical conditions.

whyChooseCards.heading: Cardiovascular Specialists
whyChooseCards.text: Our team includes interventional specialists who understand deployment mechanics, veterinary pathologists experienced with vascular healing, and regulatory experts who've guided dozens of cardiovascular devices through successful FDA submissions.

whyChooseCards.text: Over four decades of exclusive cardiovascular device testing has produced hundreds of successful FDA submissions. Our submission success rate exceeds industry averages through comprehensive preclinical packages that address reviewer expectations.

featuredServices.heading: Comprehensive DCB Validation
featuredServices.text:
Drug-coated balloons need to prove they can maintain coating integrity through tortuous anatomy, transfer therapeutic drug concentrations during brief inflation periods, and achieve sustained tissue uptake that prevents restenosis. We test coating uniformity using micro-CT and scanning electron microscopy, characterize drug elution kinetics under physiological flow conditions, and quantify vascular tissue penetration through advanced histological analysis. Our protocols evaluate coating adhesion during catheter transit, drug release during balloon inflation, and therapeutic agent retention in vessel walls throughout extended follow-up periods.

From paclitaxel-eluting systems for peripheral intervention to novel drug formulations for coronary applications, our testing addresses both device performance and pharmaceutical requirements that define combination product submissions. Our catheterization laboratories feature specialized equipment for real-time coating visualization, drug distribution mapping, and tissue uptake quantification throughout the complete deployment sequence. Whether pursuing 510(k) clearance through predicate comparison or PMA approval for breakthrough formulations, our GLP-compliant protocols generate the comprehensive data packages FDA requires for combination product approval.

heart-failure-testing.heroDescription: Comprehensive preclinical validation for mechanical circulatory support devices including LVAD performance characterization, cardiac resynchronization therapy assessment, and hemodynamic testing under GLP compliance.

subServices.heading: LVAD Testing
subServices.text: Left ventricular assist device validation with hemocompatibility assessment, pump durability protocols, and anatomical integration studies for bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy applications.

heart-failure-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Heart failure devices sustain life when cardiac function deteriorates, requiring validation that demonstrates both mechanical performance and therapeutic benefit. LVADs must maintain continuous flow across varying preload and afterload conditions while preventing hemolysis, platelet activation, and thrombotic complications. Cardiac resynchronization therapy devices need precise pacing algorithms that restore ventricular synchrony and improve ejection fraction. Temporary support systems require rapid deployment validation and stable performance during acute decompensation events.

We evaluate pump performance using pressure-volume loop analysis and real-time flow monitoring that captures hemodynamic responses across physiological stress conditions. Our catheterization laboratories feature continuous cardiac output measurement, ventricular pressure monitoring, and echocardiographic imaging that tracks device-heart interactions throughout complete cardiac cycles. Hemocompatibility testing quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet function, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 protocols adapted for rotary blood pump assessment.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide chronic implantation assessment while device-specific protocols address pump durability, electrical performance validation for CRT systems, and anatomical integration for surgical implants. Whether validating next-generation continuous-flow LVADs, percutaneous temporary support devices, or biventricular assist systems, our GLP-compliant testing addresses both PMA pathway requirements and post-market surveillance objectives.

capabilities.title: Hemodynamic Performance Assessment
capabilities.description: Pressure-volume loop analysis quantifies ventricular function, stroke work, and cardiac output under varying pump speeds. Real-time monitoring captures preload sensitivity, afterload response, and flow pulsatility across physiological conditions.

capabilities.title: Pump Performance Characterization
capabilities.description: Flow curve validation across pressure ranges evaluates pump efficiency, power consumption, and rotor speed stability. Testing protocols assess continuous-flow dynamics, pulsatile performance, and flow modulation capabilities for physiological adaptation.

capabilities.title: Hemocompatibility and Blood Damage Assessment
capabilities.description: ISO 10993-4 compliant testing quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet activation markers, and von Willebrand factor degradation. Specialized protocols evaluate shear stress effects, thrombogenic potential, and anticoagulation requirements for chronic blood contact.

capabilities.title: Durability and Accelerated Wear Testing
capabilities.description: Long-term durability protocols simulate years of continuous operation through accelerated cycling. Performance monitoring detects bearing wear, seal degradation, and rotor dynamics changes while validating backup power systems and alarm functions.

capabilities.title: Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy Validation
capabilities.description: Biventricular pacing optimization uses echocardiography to assess ventricular synchrony improvement and ejection fraction enhancement. Lead positioning validation, pacing threshold characterization, and sensing algorithm verification address CRT-specific performance requirements.

capabilities.title: Anatomical Integration and Biocompatibility
capabilities.description: Chronic implantation studies evaluate tissue response at pump-myocardium interfaces, cannula positioning stability, and healing patterns around device components. Histopathological analysis characterizes fibrosis, inflammation, and cellular responses using standardized scoring systems.

heart-valve-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Heart valve devices face relentless mechanical demands opening and closing 100,000 times daily while maintaining hemodynamic performance that prevents heart failure progression. Transcatheter and surgical valves require comprehensive validation beyond basic durability testing. We evaluate deployment precision in challenging anatomies, quantify paravalvular leak across varying calcification patterns, and assess long-term structural integrity through accelerated wear protocols.

Our pulse duplicator systems replicate physiological conditions across left and right heart environments while advanced imaging captures valve positioning, leaflet motion, and regurgitation throughout complete cardiac cycles. From TAVR platforms requiring annular sealing validation to mitral repair devices demanding precise grasping force characterization, our protocols address the specific challenges each valve design presents.

ISO 5840 compliance guides our testing methodology while four decades of structural heart experience informs protocol development that addresses FDA expectations. Whether validating balloon-expandable TAVR crimping profiles or assessing edge-to-edge repair durability, our catheterization laboratories provide the specialized infrastructure and expertise valve development demands.

structural-heart-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Structural heart devices operate in anatomical environments where standard cardiovascular testing protocols fall short. LAA closure systems must seal appendages with chicken wing, cactus, cauliflower, and windsock morphologies while preventing peridevice leaks that compromise stroke protection. Septal defect occluders need stable positioning across varying defect geometries with tissue integration that creates permanent closure. Transcatheter repair platforms require precise deployment in moving cardiac structures while maintaining device stability throughout continuous cardiac cycles.

We evaluate deployment accuracy using high-resolution fluoroscopy and transesophageal echocardiography that captures device positioning throughout complete cardiac motion. Our catheterization laboratories feature specialized left atrial access capabilities, anatomical models representing morphological variations, and hemodynamic monitoring systems that assess device performance under physiological conditions. From device-tissue interface characterization to chronic endothelialization studies, our protocols address the specific challenges structural heart technologies present.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide chronic implantation assessment while device-specific protocols address deployment mechanics, anatomical compatibility across patient populations, and long-term tissue integration. Whether validating Watchman LAA occluders refined through dozens of studies, novel septal closure systems, or emerging transcatheter repair platforms, our GLP-compliant testing addresses both PMA pathway requirements and post-market surveillance objectives across structural heart device categories.

capabilities.title: Anatomical Compatibility Assessment
capabilities.description: Deployment validation across morphological variants using anatomically accurate models that replicate chicken wing, cactus, cauliflower, and windsock LAA configurations plus varying septal defect geometries. Advanced imaging provides detailed anatomical measurements and device sizing verification.

capabilities.title: Deployment Mechanics Characterization
capabilities.description: High-resolution fluoroscopy and transesophageal echocardiography capture device deployment dynamics, positioning accuracy, and stability during cardiac motion. Specialized protocols assess delivery system performance, retrieval capabilities, and deployment consistency across anatomical variations.

capabilities.title: Occlusion Effectiveness and Leak Assessment
capabilities.description: Advanced flow measurement techniques quantify LAA occlusion completeness, peridevice leak detection, and septal defect closure effectiveness. Real-time imaging during deployment enables sealing optimization while long-term studies validate permanent closure maintenance.

capabilities.title: Chronic Tissue Integration Studies
capabilities.description: Extended observation protocols evaluate endothelialization progression, device-tissue interface healing, and biological integration patterns. Histopathological analysis characterizes tissue ingrowth, cellular responses, and complete endothelial coverage development using standardized scoring systems.

capabilities.title: Device Stability and Durability Testing
capabilities.description: Cardiac cycle simulation assesses device positioning stability, anchoring mechanism integrity, and structural performance throughout extended physiological loading. Accelerated fatigue protocols characterize material durability and predict long-term device behavior.

capabilities.title: Biocompatibility and Thrombogenicity Evaluation
capabilities.description: ISO 10993-4 compliant hemocompatibility testing addresses blood contact requirements while specialized thrombogenicity protocols evaluate clot formation potential under atrial fibrillation flow patterns. Chronic biocompatibility studies assess tissue response and material integration over implant lifetime.

arrhythmia-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Cardiac rhythm management devices sustain life through precise electrical therapy, requiring validation that demonstrates reliable sensing, appropriate pacing, and effective arrhythmia termination across varying physiological conditions. Pacemakers must detect intrinsic cardiac activity while delivering therapy that maintains adequate heart rate without depleting battery reserves prematurely. ICDs face the additional challenge of discriminating life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias from benign rhythms while delivering high-voltage therapy that terminates fibrillation without causing unnecessary shocks that traumatize patients and accelerate device replacement.

We evaluate electrical performance using specialized electrophysiology systems that capture pacing thresholds, sensing amplitudes, and impedance measurements with microsecond precision. Our catheterization laboratories feature programmable cardiac simulation systems, real-time rhythm analysis capabilities, and high-voltage testing infrastructure that characterizes defibrillation efficacy across multiple energy levels. From sensing algorithm validation to battery longevity projection, our protocols address the complex interaction between device electronics, lead systems, and cardiac tissue throughout chronic implantation periods.

ISO 14708 series standards guide cardiac device assessment while FDA guidance documents for active implantable medical devices inform protocol development. Whether validating leadless pacemaker platforms, MRI-conditional ICD systems, or cardiac resynchronization therapy devices, our GLP-compliant testing addresses both PMA pathway requirements and post-market surveillance objectives for Class III life-sustaining devices.

capabilities.title: Electrical Performance Characterization
capabilities.description: Pacing output validation across voltage and pulse width ranges, sensing threshold assessment for P-wave and R-wave detection, and impedance measurement throughout chronic implantation. Battery performance evaluation projects device longevity under varying pacing burden scenarios.

capabilities.title: Arrhythmia Detection Algorithm Validation
capabilities.description: Detection sensitivity testing across ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation presentations, specificity assessment for supraventricular tachycardia rejection, and rate discrimination validation. Advanced algorithms including morphology analysis and sudden onset criteria undergo comprehensive evaluation.

capabilities.title: Defibrillation Efficacy Assessment
capabilities.description: High-voltage testing characterizes defibrillation thresholds across multiple energy levels while waveform optimization validates biphasic shock delivery. Capacitor charging performance, shock impedance measurement, and therapy success rate analysis address ICD-specific requirements.

capabilities.title: Lead System Performance and Durability
capabilities.description: Chronic electrical integrity assessment evaluates conductor resistance stability, insulation performance under flexion stress, and lead-tissue interface impedance changes. Mechanical durability protocols simulate years of cardiac motion through accelerated fatigue testing.

Specialized protocols evaluate hemocompatibility for blood-contacting components, muscle stimulation effects, and long-term tissue response at lead-myocardium interfaces.

coronary-stent-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Coronary stent development requires validation that addresses mechanical performance, biological safety, and therapeutic efficacy across diverse platform types. Drug-eluting stents face additional complexity as combination products requiring integrated assessment of device mechanics, polymer coating performance, and pharmacological activity. Whether validating bare metal platforms through radial strength and biocompatibility testing or characterizing drug-eluting systems with complex elution profiles, successful regulatory submissions demand comprehensive preclinical data addressing FDA expectations for both immediate performance and long-term vascular healing.

We evaluate mechanical integrity through radial force measurement, crush resistance assessment, and accelerated durability protocols that simulate years of cardiac loading. Our catheterization laboratories feature high-resolution fluoroscopy and intravascular ultrasound capabilities enabling deployment characterization in anatomically accurate coronary models. For drug-eluting platforms, specialized analytical systems quantify drug release kinetics through HPLC analysis while tissue distribution studies map therapeutic agent penetration patterns in vessel walls. Polymer coating assessment utilizes scanning electron microscopy and advanced imaging techniques identifying uniformity, adhesion characteristics, and structural integrity throughout deployment sequences.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide material evaluation while ISO 25539 specifications inform mechanical testing protocols for vascular stents. Drug-eluting platforms require additional FDA guidance consideration addressing combination product requirements, drug-specific toxicology, and polymer biocompatibility assessment. Our testing addresses both 510(k) substantial equivalence demonstrations and PMA pathway requirements for breakthrough technologies, providing complete validation packages supporting regulatory submissions across bare metal designs, established drug-eluting platforms, bioresorbable scaffolds, and novel therapeutic combinations.

capabilities.title: Mechanical Performance Validation
capabilities.description: Radial strength measurement across expansion ranges, recoil assessment following deployment, and fatigue durability testing through accelerated cardiac cycle simulation. Crush resistance protocols validate performance under external compression while deployment characterization addresses foreshortening, dog-boning, and uniform expansion profiles.

capabilities.title: Drug Elution Characterization
capabilities.description: HPLC-based release kinetics quantification under physiological flow conditions, coating uniformity assessment through advanced microscopy, and tissue uptake validation measuring therapeutic agent distribution in arterial walls. Multi-phase elution profiling characterizes burst release, sustained delivery, and long-term drug availability patterns.

capabilities.title: Vascular Healing Assessment

Endothelialization studies track vessel healing while restenosis quantification evaluates lumen area preservation and late loss measurements addressing long-term patency.

Specialized protocols assess polymer-drug interactions and coating integrity throughout shelf life and deployment.

Thrombogenicity assessment evaluates acute clot formation risk while chronic studies address late thrombosis potential requiring extended antiplatelet therapy.

icd-testing.title: ICD Testing Services | Synchrony Labs
icd-testing.heroDescription: Comprehensive preclinical validation for implantable cardioverter defibrillators with arrhythmia detection algorithm testing, high-voltage defibrillation efficacy assessment, shock delivery characterization, and electromagnetic compatibility evaluation using GLP-compliant methodologies for life-sustaining device submissions.
icd-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Implantable cardioverter defibrillators prevent sudden cardiac death through rapid arrhythmia detection and high-voltage therapy delivery, requiring validation that demonstrates reliable detection algorithms while delivering effective defibrillation without unnecessary shocks. ICDs must discriminate life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias from benign rhythms while charging capacitors rapidly and delivering therapy that terminates fibrillation consistently. Transvenous systems demand comprehensive lead validation while subcutaneous platforms require alternative pathway characterization and CRT-D devices need biventricular pacing assessment alongside defibrillation capability.

We evaluate ICD performance using specialized electrophysiology systems that induce ventricular arrhythmias and assess detection accuracy with millisecond precision. Our high-voltage testing infrastructure characterizes defibrillation thresholds across energy levels while waveform optimization validates biphasic shock delivery effectiveness. Arrhythmia simulation capabilities test detection algorithms across varying ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation presentations while electromagnetic compatibility chambers assess device performance near MRI systems and medical equipment generating electromagnetic interference.

ISO 14708 series standards guide ICD assessment while FDA guidance documents for active implantable cardioverter defibrillators inform protocol development addressing defibrillation efficacy, sensing accuracy, and electromagnetic safety requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA pathways for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating traditional transvenous ICDs, subcutaneous systems avoiding intracardiac leads, or CRT-D platforms combining resynchronization and defibrillation therapy, our protocols demonstrate detection reliability, shock efficacy, and electromagnetic compatibility that sudden cardiac death prevention devices demand.

des-testing.title: Drug-Eluting Stent Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
des-testing.heroDescription: Drug-eluting stents face unique validation challenges as combination products requiring both device and drug assessment. We test drug release patterns, polymer coating performance, tissue uptake levels, and vascular healing across paclitaxel, sirolimus, and everolimus platforms for both 510(k) and PMA submissions.
des-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Drug-eluting stents require validation beyond mechanical testing because the polymer coating must release drug at precise rates while staying intact during deployment. The drug needs to reach vessel walls at therapeutic levels that prevent restenosis without causing toxicity. This combination product challenge means we test both device mechanics and drug delivery together, validating how the coating performs during balloon expansion and how effectively the drug penetrates arterial tissue.

We track drug release using HPLC analysis that measures elution over time under flow conditions that match coronary arteries. Scanning electron microscopy shows coating uniformity across stent struts while tissue samples reveal drug concentration in vessel walls. Our testing captures how drugs like paclitaxel and sirolimus distribute through arterial layers, measuring the tissue levels that determine whether the stent prevents smooth muscle cell growth effectively.

Drug-eluting stents follow FDA combination product rules requiring coordination between device and drug review centers. We conduct ISO 10993 biocompatibility testing adapted for drug-eluting systems while ISO 25539 guides mechanical validation. Our protocols address both 510(k) pathways comparing to predicate devices and PMA submissions for breakthrough technologies. Testing demonstrates that polymer coatings maintain drug stability through sterilization and shelf life while delivering therapeutic benefit during vascular healing.

capabilities.description: Scanning electron microscopy and mechanical testing evaluate coating thickness, uniformity across stent struts, and adhesion strength during balloon expansion to ensure coating stays intact during deployment without cracking or peeling.

capabilities.title: Tissue Drug Uptake Analysis
capabilities.description: Quantitative tissue analysis measures drug concentrations in arterial wall layers, mapping how deeply drugs like paclitaxel and sirolimus penetrate to reach smooth muscle cells where they prevent restenosis.

capabilities.description: Combined testing evaluates stent radial strength, recoil behavior, and coating integrity simultaneously during deployment to ensure mechanical forces don't damage the polymer coating or affect drug delivery.

heart-pump-testing.heroDescription: Comprehensive preclinical validation for mechanical circulatory support devices with pump performance characterization, hemocompatibility assessment, durability protocols, and hemodynamic testing under physiological conditions using GLP-compliant methodologies.
heart-pump-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Mechanical circulatory support devices sustain life by generating continuous flow, requiring validation that demonstrates reliable pump performance while preventing blood damage and thrombotic complications. Heart pumps must maintain 5 liters per minute across varying preload and afterload conditions while operating continuously for months or years without mechanical failure. Continuous-flow platforms demand specialized shear stress assessment while pulsatile systems require complex timing validation and chamber pressurization characterization.

We evaluate pump performance using pressure-flow curve analysis and real-time hemodynamic monitoring that captures output stability across physiological stress conditions. Our catheterization laboratories feature mock circulation loops replicating normal and failing heart hemodynamics while specialized test fixtures accommodate both implantable and percutaneous pump configurations. Hemocompatibility protocols quantify hemolysis indices, platelet activation markers, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 adapted for high-shear blood pump environments.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide chronic implantation assessment while device-specific protocols address pump durability through accelerated fatigue testing, flow dynamics optimization, and anatomical integration studies. Our GLP-compliant testing addresses PMA pathway requirements for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating next-generation LVADs, temporary support systems, or total artificial hearts, our protocols demonstrate both mechanical reliability and hemocompatibility performance that regulatory submissions demand.

lvad-testing.title: LVAD Testing Services | Synchrony Labs
lvad-testing.heroDescription: Comprehensive preclinical validation for left ventricular assist devices with hemocompatibility assessment under continuous flow conditions, pump durability protocols, driveline interface evaluation, and ventricular interaction analysis using GLP-compliant methodologies.
lvad-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Left ventricular assist devices provide life-sustaining cardiac support, requiring validation that demonstrates pump reliability while preventing thrombosis, hemolysis, and infection complications throughout extended implantation periods. LVADs must maintain continuous flow supporting 5-6 liters per minute while preserving ventricular function and enabling potential cardiac recovery. Continuous-flow platforms demand specialized assessment of shear-induced blood damage while pump-ventricle interaction analysis ensures optimal hemodynamic support across varying cardiac function levels.

We evaluate LVAD performance using pressure-volume loop analysis and ventricular function monitoring that captures device-heart interaction throughout cardiac cycles. Our catheterization laboratories feature mock circulation systems replicating normal and failing heart conditions while specialized surgical models enable driveline tunneling assessment and percutaneous site evaluation. Hemocompatibility testing quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet activation, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 protocols adapted for chronic continuous-flow environments found in destination therapy applications.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide long-term implantation assessment while FDA guidance documents for ventricular assist devices inform protocol development addressing pump durability, electrical safety, and infection resistance requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA pathways for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating next-generation miniaturized LVADs, pediatric platforms, or destination therapy systems, our protocols demonstrate mechanical reliability, hemocompatibility performance, and driveline integrity that bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy indications demand.

capabilities.title: Pump-Ventricle Interaction Analysis
capabilities.description: Pressure-volume loop characterization quantifies ventricular unloading, inflow cannula positioning effects, and outflow graft hemodynamics while assessing cardiac output augmentation and potential for myocardial recovery across heart failure severities

capabilities.title: Continuous-Flow Hemocompatibility Assessment
capabilities.description: ISO 10993-4 compliant testing adapted for continuous-flow devices quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet function changes, and von Willebrand factor degradation while evaluating thrombogenic potential under chronic anticoagulation scenarios typical of LVAD therapy

capabilities.title: Pump Durability and Reliability Testing
capabilities.description: Accelerated fatigue protocols simulate years of continuous operation through millions of pump cycles with performance monitoring detecting bearing wear, seal integrity changes, and motor efficiency degradation addressing destination therapy durability requirements

capabilities.title: Driveline Interface and Infection Resistance
capabilities.description: Percutaneous exit site assessment evaluates tissue integration at skin-driveline interfaces while infection challenge studies characterize bacterial colonization resistance and biofilm formation potential across extended implantation periods

capabilities.title: Flow Dynamics and Thrombosis Assessment
capabilities.description: Advanced flow visualization identifies stasis regions within pump chambers that promote thrombus formation while computational fluid dynamics validation assesses shear stress distribution affecting blood damage and platelet activation

capabilities.title: Controller and Power System Validation
capabilities.description: Electrical safety testing per IEC 60601 standards validates controller performance, battery longevity, and alarm system reliability while electromagnetic compatibility assessment ensures device operation across environmental conditions and medical equipment proximity

tavr-testing.title: TAVR Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
tavr-testing.heroDescription: Successful aortic valve replacement depends on precise deployment in calcified tissue, complete sealing without paravalvular leak, and preserved blood flow to coronary arteries. We test positioning accuracy, measure hemodynamic performance, and validate whether your TAVR system performs safely across varying anatomies.
tavr-testing.primaryContentDescription:
TAVR devices must deploy accurately despite heavy calcification, seal completely against irregular tissue, and avoid blocking coronary arteries. Small positioning errors cause permanent pacemaker needs or dangerous leaks. We test whether your valve expands uniformly, whether balloon-inflatable frames maintain position during inflation, and whether self-expanding systems provide consistent radial force.

We measure deployment precision using biplane fluoroscopy that captures valve positioning from multiple angles. Our aortic root models range from normal anatomy to severely calcified bicuspid valves where standard TAVR approaches fail. Pulse duplicator systems measure pressure gradients across your valve while flow imaging reveals paravalvular leak patterns. We quantify coronary ostia clearance, conduction bundle proximity, and sealing effectiveness.

ISO 5840 standards guide our TAVR testing protocols. FDA guidance documents for transcatheter aortic valves inform our study designs, ensuring we generate the hemodynamic benchmarks and safety data your PMA or 510(k) requires. Our GLP-compliant testing addresses balloon-expandable and self-expanding platforms, standard TAVR procedures, and specialized applications including valve-in-valve implantation.

capabilities.title: Deployment Precision and Anatomical Compatibility
capabilities.description: We measure positioning accuracy across aortic models from small annuli to bicuspid valves. Testing quantifies deployment forces, captures expansion dynamics with high-speed fluoroscopy, and validates whether your system achieves optimal positioning in challenging anatomies where calcification or irregular geometry complicates standard deployment. (48 words)

capabilities.title: Paravalvular Leak Measurement and Sealing Validation
capabilities.description: Advanced flow systems quantify leak severity through regurgitant fraction calculations and real-time jet visualization. We identify leak locations, measure sealing skirt effectiveness, and determine whether calcium displacement creates gaps. Testing addresses immediate post-deployment leak and performance after millions of cardiac cycles. (45 words)

capabilities.title: Hemodynamic Performance Under Physiological Conditions
capabilities.description: Pulse duplicators replicate aortic pressure and flow conditions while measuring transvalvular gradients, effective orifice area, and coronary flow patterns. We validate ISO 5840 performance requirements, compare hemodynamic benefits of different valve designs, and ensure adequate blood flow throughout complete cardiac cycles. (44 words)

capabilities.title: Coronary Flow Preservation and Obstruction Risk
capabilities.description: We measure coronary ostia clearance during deployment and validate flow to coronary arteries. Testing uses specialized models with functional coronary vessels, fluoroscopic visualization during valve expansion, and flow measurement confirming adequate perfusion. Protocols identify obstruction risks before clinical use. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Durability Testing and Accelerated Wear Protocols
capabilities.description: Fatigue testing simulates 200-400 million cycles representing decades of valve function. We monitor for frame fractures, leaflet tears, and hemodynamic degradation. Continuous tracking detects early structural failures while measuring whether sealing effectiveness and flow performance persist throughout projected device lifetime. (43 words)

capabilities.title: Conduction System Safety and Pacemaker Risk Assessment
capabilities.description: We evaluate valve positioning relative to conduction pathways, measure frame contact with septal tissue, and assess pacemaker implantation risk. Testing validates whether design modifications reduce conduction disturbances or if deeper deployment increases paravalvular leak trade-offs. (38 words)

mitraclip-testing.title: MitraClip Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
mitraclip-testing.heroDescription: Successful mitral repair depends on secure leaflet grasping without tissue damage, precise positioning targeting regurgitant jets, and maintained coaptation throughout cardiac cycles. We test grasping forces, measure residual regurgitation, and validate whether your clip creates effective double-orifice repair across varying tissue pathologies.
mitraclip-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Edge-to-edge mitral repair requires clips that grasp leaflets securely without tearing tissue, position accurately in moving cardiac structures, and reduce regurgitation without creating excessive stenosis. Too little grasping force allows leaflet slippage while too much damages tissue. We test whether your clip applies optimal pressure, whether grippers hold throughout millions of cardiac cycles, and whether multi-clip strategies achieve adequate repair.

We measure grasping forces using specialized sensors that quantify leaflet compression and holding strength. Our mitral models replicate both degenerative disease with flail leaflets and functional regurgitation from dilated ventricles. Three-dimensional echocardiography visualizes leaflet capture in real-time while flow measurement quantifies residual regurgitation. Testing addresses single and multiple clip deployments across varying mitral anatomies.

ISO 5840 standards guide our transcatheter valve testing protocols. FDA guidance for mitral repair devices informs study designs addressing hemodynamic safety, procedural feasibility, and durability requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for innovative repair technologies and 510(k) applications demonstrating substantial equivalence to established platforms.

capabilities.title: Leaflet Grasping Force Measurement and Optimization
capabilities.description: We quantify clip closure pressure across leaflet tissue, measure holding strength under physiological loading, and validate whether grasping forces remain adequate after millions of cardiac cycles. Testing determines optimal pressure balancing secure leaflet capture against tissue damage risk. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Deployment Accuracy and Positioning Control
capabilities.description: We evaluate positioning precision within moving mitral structures using three-dimensional echocardiography. Testing measures whether delivery systems enable accurate jet targeting, whether independent gripper control improves leaflet capture, and whether clips achieve intended positioning despite cardiac motion throughout deployment sequences. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Residual Regurgitation Quantification and Repair Effectiveness
capabilities.description: Advanced flow systems measure regurgitation reduction through regurgitant fraction calculations and jet visualization. We quantify residual leak severity, map remaining leak locations, and determine whether repair achieves adequate regurgitation reduction without creating mitral stenosis that impairs cardiac output. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Coaptation Length Validation and Double-Orifice Function
capabilities.description: We measure coaptation length created by leaflet grasping, validate double-orifice configuration effectiveness, and assess whether adequate leaflet tissue bridge forms. Testing determines if clip width provides sufficient coaptation for broad regurgitant jets and whether tissue accommodation occurs throughout cardiac cycles. (43 words)

capabilities.title: Multi-Clip Strategy Testing and Device Interaction
capabilities.description: For complex regurgitation requiring multiple clips, we evaluate clip spacing optimization, measure device-device interactions, and quantify cumulative regurgitation reduction. Testing validates whether multi-clip approaches avoid excessive mitral stenosis while achieving adequate repair across large or multiple regurgitant jets. (40 words)

capabilities.title: Durability Assessment and Long-Term Stability
capabilities.description: Accelerated fatigue protocols simulate years of cardiac cycles while monitoring gripper integrity, clip arm stability, and maintained leaflet capture. We measure whether grasping forces persist, if tissue response affects clip position, and whether regurgitation reduction remains stable throughout projected device lifetime. (44 words)

sapien-valve-testing.title: Sapien Valve Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
sapien-valve-testing.heroDescription: Successful balloon-expandable TAVR depends on controlled expansion without frame recoil, predictable positioning during balloon inflation, and complete sealing in calcified tissue. We test crimping profile recovery, measure deployment forces during expansion, and validate whether your valve achieves optimal geometry across varying inflation pressures.
sapien-valve-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Balloon-expandable TAVR systems must crimp to small profiles without damaging leaflets, expand uniformly when inflated, and maintain position without recoil after balloon deflation. We test whether your valve recovers from crimping stress, whether balloon inflation displaces calcium effectively, and whether frame geometry remains stable post-deployment. Testing measures expansion pressures, radial forces, and sealing effectiveness.

We characterize crimping behavior using specialized equipment that measures profile reduction and leaflet integrity. Deployment testing uses controlled balloon inflation while biplane fluoroscopy captures expansion dynamics and calcium displacement. Our calcified aortic models replicate severe stenosis where uneven expansion creates dangerous leaks. Flow measurement systems quantify paravalvular leak patterns specific to balloon-expandable platforms.

ISO 5840 standards guide our balloon-expandable valve testing. FDA guidance for TAVR devices informs protocols addressing deployment safety, hemodynamic benchmarks, and durability requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for innovative balloon-expandable technologies and 510(k) applications demonstrating substantial equivalence to established Sapien platforms.

capabilities.title: Crimping Profile Validation and Leaflet Integrity
capabilities.description: We measure crimped valve diameter, assess leaflet damage from compression, and validate recovery after expansion. Testing quantifies whether crimping stress causes leaflet tearing or frame deformation. Specialized imaging captures leaflet configuration throughout crimping and re-expansion sequences. (40 words)

capabilities.title: Balloon Expansion Mechanics and Deployment Forces
capabilities.description: We measure balloon inflation pressures required for complete expansion, quantify radial forces during deployment, and capture frame geometry development using high-speed fluoroscopy. Testing validates whether expansion occurs uniformly or if calcium creates asymmetric loading that distorts valve shape. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Frame Recoil Measurement and Position Stability
capabilities.description: After balloon deflation, we measure frame recoil and position migration. Testing quantifies whether cobalt-chromium frames maintain intended diameter or if elastic recoil reduces effective orifice area. Stability assessment determines if valves shift position after balloon removal. (39 words)

capabilities.title: Calcium Displacement and Annular Contact Patterns
capabilities.description: We evaluate how balloon expansion displaces calcium nodules, whether displacement creates complete annular contact, and if uneven calcium distribution causes persistent leak paths. Testing uses heavily calcified models where balloon force distribution determines sealing success. (39 words)

capabilities.title: Paravalvular Leak Assessment in Calcified Anatomy
capabilities.description: Advanced flow systems quantify leak severity specific to balloon-expandable deployment. We identify leak locations relative to calcium distribution, measure whether sealing skirts accommodate irregular surfaces, and determine if higher inflation pressures improve sealing without causing annular rupture. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Accelerated Durability and Frame Integrity
capabilities.description: Fatigue protocols simulate millions of cardiac cycles while monitoring cobalt-chromium frame stability, bovine pericardial leaflet performance, and suture line integrity. We measure whether balloon expansion creates stress concentrations that accelerate frame fatigue or if deployment damage affects long-term durability. (44 words)

whyChooseCards.heading: Decades of Balloon-Expandable Valve Experience
whyChooseCards.text: We have tested balloon-expandable TAVR systems for years, supporting multiple FDA approvals. evolut-testing.title: Evolut Valve Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
evolut-testing.heroDescription: Successful repositionable TAVR depends on controlled self-expansion, safe retrieval and redeployment mechanics, and maintained performance after multiple positioning attempts. We test nitinol frame behavior, measure repositioning impact on valve integrity, and validate whether your system enables procedural optimization through recapture functionality.
evolut-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Repositionable self-expanding TAVR systems must deploy predictably through controlled nitinol expansion, allow retrieval when positioning is suboptimal, and maintain structural integrity through multiple deployment attempts. We test whether your valve's nitinol frame self-expands at consistent rates, whether retrieval mechanisms function safely, and whether performance remains acceptable after recapture and redeployment sequences.

We measure self-expansion rates using specialized monitoring systems that capture frame deployment dynamics. Testing validates retrieval forces, quantifies nitinol stress during recapture, and assesses whether multiple deployment cycles damage leaflets or frame structure. Our aortic models enable repositioning validation across anatomical variations where initial deployment may require adjustment. Supra-annular positioning is evaluated for hemodynamic advantages over intra-annular designs.

ISO 5840 standards guide our self-expanding valve testing. FDA guidance for TAVR devices with repositioning capabilities informs protocols addressing enhanced procedural control and safety validation. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for innovative repositionable technologies and 510(k) applications demonstrating substantial equivalence to established Evolut platforms.

capabilities.title: Nitinol Frame Self-Expansion and Deployment Control
capabilities.description: We measure self-expansion rates, quantify radial forces throughout deployment, and validate positioning control as the frame releases from delivery sheaths. Testing captures expansion dynamics using high-speed fluoroscopy while measuring whether temperature variations affect deployment predictability. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Retrieval and Redeployment Mechanics Validation
capabilities.description: We test whether retrieval mechanisms function reliably, measure forces required for recapture, and validate valve integrity after repositioning. Testing determines how many deployment attempts your system tolerates before structural damage occurs or performance degrades below acceptable thresholds. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Repositioning Impact on Valve Performance
capabilities.description: After recapture and redeployment sequences, we measure hemodynamic performance, inspect for leaflet damage, and quantify frame deformation. Testing validates whether repositioning affects paravalvular sealing, if leaflet function remains normal, and whether chronic radial force degrades after multiple deployment attempts. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Supra-Annular Positioning and Hemodynamic Advantages
capabilities.description: We measure effective orifice area benefits from elevated leaflet positioning, quantify transvalvular gradient reductions, and compare hemodynamic performance against intra-annular designs. Testing validates whether supra-annular placement provides measurable flow improvements justifying self-expanding platform selection. (38 words)

capabilities.title: Chronic Radial Force and Long-Term Stability
capabilities.description: We measure radial forces immediately post-deployment and throughout accelerated aging protocols. Testing determines whether nitinol maintains adequate outward force preventing frame collapse or migration, if chronic loading affects expansion geometry, and whether sealing effectiveness persists throughout projected device lifetime. (43 words)

capabilities.title: Nitinol Durability and Fatigue Resistance
capabilities.description: Accelerated fatigue testing simulates millions of cardiac cycles while monitoring nitinol frame integrity. We measure whether repositioning creates stress concentrations accelerating fracture, if high-cycle loading causes frame deformation, and whether porcine pericardial leaflets maintain performance throughout durability protocols. (41 words)

pascal-testing.title: Pascal Device Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
pascal-testing.heroDescription: Successful advanced mitral repair depends on independent leaflet grasping control, effective spacer deployment creating tissue bridges, and broad paddle coaptation addressing complex regurgitation. We test independent gripper mechanics, measure spacer technology performance, and validate whether your system achieves superior coaptation compared to conventional edge-to-edge repair.
pascal-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Advanced mitral repair with independent grippers and spacer technology must grasp leaflets sequentially with separate control, deploy spacers that fill regurgitant gaps, and create broad coaptation areas through paddle design. We test whether independent gripper control improves leaflet capture success, whether spacer deployment forces remain safe, and whether broad paddles enhance repair effectiveness in challenging anatomies like large flail segments.

We measure forces for each independent gripper separately, quantifying sequential leaflet capture mechanics. Spacer deployment testing validates controlled expansion, tissue compression characteristics, and bridge formation effectiveness. Three-dimensional echocardiography captures paddle positioning, coaptation length measurement, and residual leak patterns. Testing compares performance against conventional single-gripper designs across primary and secondary regurgitation pathologies.

ISO 5840 standards guide our mitral device testing. FDA guidance for transcatheter mitral repair informs protocols addressing innovative repair technologies requiring comprehensive safety validation. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for advanced repair systems demonstrating advantages over established edge-to-edge platforms.

capabilities.title: Independent Gripper Mechanics and Sequential Capture
capabilities.description: We measure individual gripper forces separately, quantify leaflet compression per gripper, and validate sequential capture timing. Testing determines whether independent control improves deployment success in challenging anatomies where simultaneous leaflet capture fails, measuring performance benefits over conventional designs. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Spacer Technology Deployment and Tissue Bridge Formation
capabilities.description: We test spacer expansion mechanics, measure deployment forces, and validate tissue bridge creation between leaflets. Testing determines whether spacer compression remains safe for tissue, if bridge formation fills regurgitant gaps effectively, and whether spacer technology enhances repair durability. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Broad Paddle Coaptation and Enhanced Surface Area
capabilities.description: We measure coaptation length created by paddle design, quantify contact area between paddles, and validate whether broader coaptation improves repair effectiveness. Testing compares paddle performance against narrower conventional designs, particularly for large flail segments or complex regurgitation patterns requiring enhanced leaflet contact. (44 words)

capabilities.title: Regurgitation Reduction in Complex Anatomies
capabilities.description: We quantify repair effectiveness across challenging mitral pathologies including large flail segments, multiple regurgitant jets, and severe functional regurgitation. Testing measures whether independent grippers and spacer technology enable adequate repair where conventional edge-to-edge approaches fail. (39 words)

capabilities.title: Multi-Device Strategy and Spacing Optimization
capabilities.description: For severe regurgitation requiring multiple devices, we test optimal spacing between Pascal clips, measure cumulative regurgitation reduction, and validate whether multi-device deployment avoids excessive stenosis. Testing addresses device-device interactions and spacing strategies maximizing repair effectiveness. (38 words)

capabilities.title: Durability of Advanced Repair Components
capabilities.description: Accelerated fatigue testing simulates years of cardiac loading while monitoring independent gripper integrity, spacer structural stability, and broad paddle performance. We measure whether advanced features introduce failure modes or if independent mechanics and spacer technology maintain long-term effectiveness. (42 words)

tendyne-testing.title: Tendyne Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
tendyne-testing.heroDescription: Successful transapical mitral replacement depends on secure apical anchoring without ventricular dysfunction, D-shaped frame expansion accommodating elliptical annuli, and optimal tether tension balancing stability against cardiac mechanics. We test apical delivery forces, measure tether tension ranges, and validate whether your D-shaped frame achieves complete mitral sealing.
tendyne-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Transapical mitral replacement with tether anchoring must deliver valves safely through ventricular walls, expand D-shaped frames conforming to elliptical mitral geometry, and maintain position through tether tension without constraining cardiac function. We test whether apical access creates acceptable tissue trauma, whether tether forces secure valves adequately, and whether D-shaped expansion achieves paravalvular sealing in irregular mitral annuli.

We measure apical delivery insertion forces, quantify tissue trauma from ventricular penetration, and validate closure adequacy. Tether tension testing uses force sensors measuring optimal ranges preventing migration while avoiding excessive ventricular constraint. D-shaped frame testing validates expansion across varying mitral geometries using anatomical models representing annular irregularities. Hemodynamic assessment measures transvalvular gradients and flow patterns specific to mitral position.

ISO 5840 standards guide our mitral valve testing. FDA guidance for transcatheter mitral devices informs protocols addressing transapical access safety, tether anchoring validation, and mitral hemodynamic benchmarks. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for innovative mitral replacement technologies where limited predicate devices require comprehensive safety and effectiveness demonstration.

capabilities.title: Apical Delivery Safety and Access Validation
capabilities.description: We measure ventricular insertion forces, quantify tissue trauma from apical access, and validate hemostasis after catheter removal. Testing determines whether delivery causes acceptable damage to ventricular walls and if apical closure techniques prevent bleeding. Chronic studies assess healing and tissue response. (45 words)

capabilities.title: Tether Tension Optimization and Anchoring Mechanics
capabilities.description: We measure optimal tether force ranges securing apical anchoring without constraining ventricular function. Testing quantifies whether tether tension prevents valve migration during cardiac contraction while avoiding excessive wall stress. Force measurement validates whether anchoring remains adequate throughout cardiac cycles and chronic loading. (44 words)

capabilities.title: D-Shaped Frame Expansion and Mitral Accommodation
capabilities.description: We test frame expansion across elliptical mitral annuli, validate D-shaped geometry conformation to irregular anatomies, and measure whether frame design achieves complete annular contact. triclip-testing.title: TriClip Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
triclip-testing.heroDescription: Successful tricuspid repair depends on secure leaflet grasping across heterogeneous tissue quality, effective multi-clip strategies addressing severely dilated annuli, and adequate regurgitation reduction in low-pressure right heart environments. We test grasping forces across anterior, posterior, and septal leaflets, measure repair effectiveness in extreme dilation, and validate right heart hemodynamic performance.
triclip-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Tricuspid edge-to-edge repair faces unique challenges beyond mitral applications. Tricuspid leaflets vary dramatically in thickness and texture from thin septal to thick anterior tissue. Annular dilation often exceeds 50mm, far beyond mitral dimensions. Right heart pressure is one-fifth of left heart, changing hemodynamic requirements. We test whether clips grasp heterogeneous leaflets securely, whether multi-clip strategies achieve adequate repair in massive dilation, and whether low venous pressure affects device performance.

We measure grasping forces separately for each leaflet type, quantifying tissue compression across thin and thick variations. Testing validates multi-clip spacing strategies for severely dilated annuli where single clips fail. Right heart anatomical models replicate extreme tricuspid dilation and varying leaflet morphologies. Hemodynamic measurement addresses low-pressure performance and cardiac output preservation throughout repair assessment.

ISO 5840 standards guide our tricuspid device testing. FDA guidance for transcatheter tricuspid interventions informs protocols addressing right heart device safety and effectiveness validation. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for tricuspid therapies where limited predicate devices and unique anatomical challenges require comprehensive safety demonstration.

capabilities.title: Heterogeneous Leaflet Grasping Across Tissue Quality
capabilities.description: We measure grasping forces separately for anterior, posterior, and septal leaflets with varying thickness and texture. Testing determines whether clips achieve secure capture across thin septal tissue and thick anterior leaflets, measuring optimal forces accommodating tricuspid heterogeneity. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Multi-Clip Strategy for Severe Annular Dilation
capabilities.description: We test clip spacing optimization in annuli exceeding 50mm where single devices fail. Testing measures cumulative regurgitation reduction with multiple clips, validates whether multi-device deployment avoids excessive stenosis, and determines optimal spacing patterns for extreme dilation. (40 words)

capabilities.title: Right Heart Hemodynamic Performance Validation
capabilities.description: We measure tricuspid gradients, right atrial pressures, and cardiac output throughout repair assessment. Testing validates whether repair maintains adequate flow in low-pressure venous environments, if stenosis risk increases with multiple clips, and whether right heart function improves after regurgitation reduction. (44 words)

capabilities.title: Repair Effectiveness in Complex Regurgitation Patterns
capabilities.description: We quantify regurgitation reduction across multiple jets and broad coaptation gaps characteristic of severe tricuspid disease. Testing measures whether edge-to-edge repair achieves adequate reduction when leaflet tethering and annular dilation create complex regurgitation patterns beyond simple central jets. (42 words)

capabilities.title: Right Heart Access and Delivery System Performance
capabilities.description: We validate transjugular and transfemoral venous access approaches, measuring catheter navigation through right atrium to tricuspid valve. Testing addresses delivery system performance in dilated right hearts where increased chamber size complicates device positioning and leaflet targeting. (41 words)

capabilities.title: Durability in Low-Pressure Environments
capabilities.description: Accelerated fatigue testing simulates years of venous pressure loading while monitoring clip integrity and leaflet capture. We measure whether low-pressure environments affect device performance differently than left heart applications, if grasping forces remain adequate, and whether tissue response differs in right heart positions. (47 words)

corevalve-testing.title: CoreValve Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
corevalve-testing.heroDescription: Successful self-expanding TAVR depends on predictable nitinol deployment without balloon inflation, adequate radial force maintaining annular seal, and supra-annular leaflet positioning maximizing flow area. We test nitinol frame mechanics, measure chronic radial forces, and validate whether your self-expanding valve achieves hemodynamic advantages over intra-annular designs.
corevalve-testing.primaryContentDescription:
Self-expanding TAVR with nitinol frames must deploy predictably through controlled self-expansion, provide adequate radial force for paravalvular sealing, and demonstrate supra-annular positioning benefits. We test whether nitinol behaves consistently across temperature variations, whether radial forces prevent migration without excessive annular stress, and whether elevated leaflet placement improves effective orifice area compared to intra-annular valve positions.

We measure nitinol transformation temperatures, quantify radial force distribution across frame geometry, and capture self-expansion rates using high-speed fluoroscopy. Testing validates whether temperature fluctuations affect deployment predictability, whether chronic radial force maintains sealing throughout accelerated aging, and whether nitinol fatigue resistance meets durability requirements. Hemodynamic assessment measures supra-annular positioning advantages through flow area quantification and gradient reduction.

ISO 5840 standards guide our self-expanding valve testing. FDA guidance for TAVR devices informs protocols addressing nitinol safety, chronic radial force requirements, and hemodynamic performance benchmarks. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA submissions for innovative self-expanding technologies and 510(k) applications demonstrating substantial equivalence to established platforms.

capabilities.title: Nitinol Framework Mechanics and Material Properties
capabilities.description: We measure transformation temperatures, quantify stress-strain relationships, and validate superelastic recovery across temperature ranges. Testing characterizes radial force distribution, chronic outward force maintenance, and temperature-dependent deployment dynamics. Material testing identifies whether nitinol properties meet performance requirements. (40 words)

capabilities.title: Self-Expansion Deployment Control and Predictability
capabilities.description: We measure self-expansion rates during frame release, quantify deployment control throughout unsheathing, and validate positioning accuracy. High-speed fluoroscopy captures expansion dynamics while testing determines whether temperature variations affect deployment predictability or if controlled release maintains positioning precision. (40 words)

capabilities.title: Chronic Radial Force and Paravalvular Sealing
capabilities.description: We measure radial forces immediately post-deployment and throughout accelerated aging protocols. Testing quantifies whether outward force provides adequate annular contact for sealing without excessive tissue stress, if force distribution patterns prevent leak, and whether chronic loading maintains sealing effectiveness. (43 words)

capabilities.title: Supra-Annular Hemodynamic Performance Benefits

Testing validates whether supra-annular placement provides measurable hemodynamic improvements justifying self-expanding platform selection. (38 words)

capabilities.title: Nitinol Fatigue Resistance and Frame Durability

We measure high-cycle fatigue performance, identify stress concentration locations, and validate whether frame maintains structural integrity throughout projected device lifetime. (39 words)

capabilities.title: Temperature Stability and Deployment Consistency
capabilities.description: We test deployment across clinically relevant temperature ranges, measuring whether variations affect expansion rates, radial forces, or positioning accuracy. Testing validates whether procedural temperature fluctuations create unpredictable deployment behaviors or if nitinol maintains consistent performance. (38 words)

glp-testing.title: GLP Testing Services | GLP Preclinical CRO | Synchrony Labs
glp-testing.heroDescription: Successful FDA submissions require preclinical data generated under protocols that FDA trusts, with documentation that survives regulatory inspection. We conduct studies under 21 CFR Part 58 Good Laboratory Practice standards, maintaining the quality assurance oversight, audit trails, and protocol adherence that FDA expects.
glp-testing.primaryContentDescription:
FDA reviewers reject submissions when they can't verify how data was collected, who collected it, or whether protocols were followed. GLP protocols create an unbreakable chain of custody from the moment a study begins until the final report reaches FDA. Every measurement, observation, and data point gets documented with timestamps, signatures, and audit trails that prove your preclinical data is reliable.

We follow written protocols approved before any work begins, and our Quality Assurance Unit operates independently from study teams to verify compliance. Studies are directed by qualified scientists who ensure protocol adherence, while automated systems capture data with built-in verification. Equipment gets calibrated on documented schedules, and any protocol deviations require written justification before they happen.

21 CFR Part 58 establishes the framework FDA uses to evaluate whether preclinical data is trustworthy. Studies conducted under these regulations create documentation that survives FDA inspection, including complete records of raw data, protocol amendments, and quality assurance audits. This standard applies to safety studies supporting 510(k) clearances, PMA approvals, and IDE applications across all device types.

capabilities.description: Documented calibration schedules, verification records, and traceability to national standards that FDA inspectors expect to see during facility inspections.

capabilities.description: Study directors trained in GLP regulations maintain responsibility for protocol adherence, data integrity, and compliance throughout the study duration.

capabilities.description: Written procedures covering every aspect of study conduct, from protocol development through final report archiving, ensuring consistency across all GLP studies.
